column4: I am installing a new ubuntu, I was wondering how you stop it automattically starting the X server (gdm), but allow it to be still started manually by startx?
use bum or update-rc.d to edit what runs at bootup, and remove gdm
why do you want to remove it?
I don't want to auto start the x server or any update to reset it to start automatically.
use bum, and remove gdm from the startup scripts.
